name: interpreter
content:
interpreter noun [C]
(BETWEEN LANGUAGES)
Add to word list
Add to word list
someone whose job is to change what someone else is saying into another language: She works as an interpreter in Brussels. Speaking through an interpreter, the president said the terms of the ceasefire were completely unacceptable.

interpreter noun [C]
(COMPUTER PROGRAM)
computing
  specialized a computer program that changes the instructions in another program into a form that can be easily understood by a computer

interpreter noun [C]
(EXPRESSING)
someone who performs a piece of music or a part in a play, etc. in a way that expresses their own ideas about its meaning: He's a noted interpreter of traditional Irish music.

Add to word list
Add to word list
a person whose job is to change what someone is saying into the words of another language: The Chinese witness testified with the help of an interpreter.
Add to word list
Add to word list
a person whose job is to change what someone is saying into another language as that person is speaking: act as/work as an interpreter She works as an interpreter for a news agency.through/via an interpreter The business leader addressed the conference through an interpreter.
IT a computer program that changes instructions into a form that can be understood and used by the computer Compare
assembler
